text: Michael Chadwick Tindall (5 April 1941 â€“ 10 August 2020) was an English former professional footballer. He was best known for his career with Aston Villa. His playing position was wing-half. Tindall started his career at South Birmingham Boys. He moved to Walsall for a short time before dropping into the non-League to play for Tamworth. Tindall played for the England youth team but never represented the senior side. Tindall died on 11 August 2020 from dementia-related problems, aged 79.Aston Villa hero dies after crippling battle with dementia ==References== Category:English footballers Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Sportspeople from Birmingham
title: Mike Tindall (footballer)
